timeline.bodyText:
Great job there in removing all the duplication in the creation of ObjectMappers 👏
I think we already addressed the issue of duplicated ObjectMappers creation in DataStore in the past.
The solution we proposed was to configure all the ObjectMappers the application uses in:

  
    
      ccd-data-store-api/src/main/java/uk/gov/hmcts/ccd/config/JacksonObjectMapperConfig.java
    
    
         Line 12
      in
      16bbdeb
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public class JacksonObjectMapperConfig { 
        
    
  


Then these get injected, for example:

  
    
      ccd-data-store-api/src/main/java/uk/gov/hmcts/ccd/domain/service/search/elasticsearch/ElasticsearchCaseSearchOperation.java
    
    
         Line 49
      in
      17c6d53
    
    
    
    

        
          
           @Qualifier("DefaultObjectMapper") ObjectMapper objectMapper, 
        
    
  


Perhaps injecting them is a better approach than using Utils classes with static methods? Not saying we should change the current solution, just want to suggest an alternative.
You could refactor this class to a bean called for example JsonService that it's configured in JacksonObjectMapperConfig as well and then itself can get injected? This would also make testability simpler.
I appreciate that would be more changes though so I'm not saying we have to do it. Just wanted to highlight the solution we had agreed in the past
timeline.author: mario-paniccia

replies.bodyText:
Actually I've noticed now that we have already a service that provides common utility methods for json operations:

  
    
      ccd-data-store-api/src/main/java/uk/gov/hmcts/ccd/domain/service/common/DefaultObjectMapperService.java
    
    
         Line 19
      in
      3310d47
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public class DefaultObjectMapperService implements ObjectMapperService { 
        
    
  


I think we are mixing up 2 separate approaches here. I'd spent some time thinking of which one is the best and then use that consistently
replies.author: mario-paniccia
